We leverage technology to empower smallholder farmers across Africa by linking them to finance, data-driven best practices, and access to local & global markets for their commodities; towards ensuring food security for all.

# Building the Largest Network of Profitable African Farmers

### What We Do
We explore a full range of agricultural technology solutions that ensure maximum value at the least possible cost to smallholder farmers and other relevant stakeholders, ultimately leading to food security for Africans and the world.
  * ### Farmer Onboarding
This is the first step in our process where we collect key farmer data (name, location, gender, facial recognition etc), group them in clusters per community, and assign a group leader to each one for better management, training, and development.
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/5fa2c6cce481b066d2270ef7dedcd09a.png)
  * ### Farm Mapping
After onboarding, we identify the coordinates and measure the size of each farmland as well as inspect viablility, particularly features like soil texture, slope & proximity to water. 
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/7b18f69a3ef9951e8272b6064cb3d1d8.png)
  * ### Input Distribution
We finance through farm inputs and not cash. At this stage, we calculate and disburse loans to smallholder farmers in form of improved seeds, fertilisers and crop protection products, based on farm mapping data and credit worthiness.
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/4488296c8ef19d0e32a7057eada6239b.png)
  * ### Field Monitoring
As soon as farm inputs are received, farmers begin to plant and we assign field officers to sets of farmer clusters to give tailored advisory, ensure adherance to data-driven best practices, and track progress till harvest. 
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/cb03a5b3ba9e1951f7f492161ee03ade.png)
  * ### Harvesting
During this period, we distribute required materials for harvest collection, receive, document and process farmer commodities for storage and digital payment, upon arrival at our warehouses.
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/2f2a6f92c6e2f6490034a08a5b7b5e2f.png)
  * ### Inventory Management
We monitor all off-taker and inventory activities on all available commodities, post harvest.
![accordionImage](https://thriveagric.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/website-cms/0d277a8277fd8103d35a2d0d24d6814c.png)

### Who We Are
We are a fast-growing agricultural technology company passionate about ensuring food security. We empower smallholder farmers, leveraging our technology to access finance, and improve productivity & sales to promote food security.
[Learn More](https://www.thriveagric.com/</about-us>)
![](https://www.thriveagric.com/)
### How We Help
We don't only support smallholder farmers, we enable the entire agriculture value chain.
![icon](https://www.thriveagric.com/)
#### Food Producers
We empower smallholder farmers with quality inputs and more to achieve optimum yield, profitable returns & lower poverty rates, while ensuring the required food supply.
![icon](https://www.thriveagric.com/)
####  Food Financiers
We provide credible financing channels and visibility into smallholder farmer operations towards achieving zero hunger, job creation, economic growth, social & financial inclusion.
![icon](https://www.thriveagric.com/)
#### Food Processors & Consumers
We are a reliable partner of choice for delivery of quality & healthy produce to meet increasing consumer demands and achieve food security.

### What We Do
We explore a full range of agricultural technology solutions that ensure maximum value at the least possible cost to smallholder farmers and other relevant stakeholders, ultimately leading to food security for Africans and the world.
  * ### Farmer Onboarding
This is the first step in our process where we collect key farmer data (name, location, gender, facial recognition etc), group them in clusters per community, and assign a group leader to each one for better management, training, and development.
![accordionImage⟨26⟩]
  * ### Farm Mapping
After onboarding, we identify the coordinates and measure the size of each farmland as well as inspect viablility, particularly features like soil texture, slope & proximity to water. 
![accordionImage⟨27⟩]
  * ### Input Distribution
We finance through farm inputs and not cash. At this stage, we calculate and disburse loans to smallholder farmers in form of improved seeds, fertilisers and crop protection products, based on farm mapping data and credit worthiness.
![accordionImage⟨28⟩]
  * ### Field Monitoring
As soon as farm inputs are received, farmers begin to plant and we assign field officers to sets of farmer clusters to give tailored advisory, ensure adherance to data-driven best practices, and track progress till harvest. 
![accordionImage⟨29⟩]
  * ### Harvesting
During this period, we distribute required materials for harvest collection, receive, document and process farmer commodities for storage and digital payment, upon arrival at our warehouses.
![accordionImage⟨30⟩]
  * ### Inventory Management
We monitor all off-taker and inventory activities on all available commodities, post harvest.
![accordionImage⟨31⟩]

### Who We Are
We are a fast-growing agricultural technology company passionate about ensuring food security. We empower smallholder farmers, leveraging our technology to access finance, and improve productivity & sales to promote food security.

### How We Help
We don't only support smallholder farmers, we enable the entire agriculture value chain.
![icon⟨25⟩]
#### Food Producers
We empower smallholder farmers with quality inputs and more to achieve optimum yield, profitable returns & lower poverty rates, while ensuring the required food supply.
![icon⟨25⟩]
####  Food Financiers
We provide credible financing channels and visibility into smallholder farmer operations towards achieving zero hunger, job creation, economic growth, social & financial inclusion.
![icon⟨25⟩]
#### Food Processors & Consumers
We are a reliable partner of choice for delivery of quality & healthy produce to meet increasing consumer demands and achieve food security.

### Thrive Agric: Empowering African Farmers Through Technology

**Overview**  
Founded in 2017 and based in Abuja, Nigeria, Thrive Agric is a dynamic agricultural technology company that is part of the Y Combinator Batch W19. With a strong team of 227 dedicated employees, Thrive Agric is on a mission to empower farmers across Africa by providing them with accessible finance, insights, and markets.

**Mission**  
Thrive Agric's mission is simple yet profound: to help farmers in Africa thrive by linking them to essential resources that enable crop growth and maximize profitability. The company aims to ensure food security for all through innovative technology solutions.

**What They Do**  
Thrive Agric started as a marketplace for agro-commodities but has grown into a comprehensive ecosystem that supports smallholder farmers. Their approach includes:

1. **Farmer Onboarding:** Collecting essential data about farmers and organizing them into community clusters for better support and education.
   
2. **Farm Mapping:** Evaluating farmland characteristics, which helps tailor financial support based on real needs.
   
3. **Input Distribution:** Offering loans in the form of farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers, rather than cash, ensuring that resources reach the farmers directly.
   
4. **Field Monitoring:** Assigning field officers to guide farmers using best practices to ensure successful harvests.
   
5. **Harvesting & Inventory Management:** Facilitating logistics for harvest collection and managing post-harvest inventory to ensure efficient supply chain operations.

**Impact**  
Thrive Agric's influence is tangible:  
- **850,000 farmers onboarded.**  
- **2,700 communities reached.**  
- **1,700,000 grains produced and traded.**  
- **9,000 jobs created.**  

These numbers illustrate Thrive Agric's commitment to transforming agriculture in Africa, linking farmers to broader markets while enhancing productivity and livelihoods.

**Recognition**  
The company celebrates notable achievements, including Uka Eje being named to the 2024 TIME100 Climate List. This recognition underscores Thrive Agric's impact on climate action through sustainable agricultural practices.

**Future Aspirations**  
Thrive Agric aims to build the largest network of profitable African farmers through technology, fostering sustainable practices that benefit both the farmers and the globe. Their work not only addresses food security but also contributes to economic growth and social inclusion across Africa.

**Get Involved**  
For those interested in joining the movement, Thrive Agric invites individuals to become a part of their community, offering career opportunities and ways to support the mission of empowering farmers.

**Learn More**  
To explore more about Thrive Agric and their initiatives, visit their [website](https://www.thriveagric.com/).
